Example_Analysis

Source: vignettes/Example_Analysis.Rmd
Example_Analysis.Rmd
library(inteRact)
library(tidyverse)
#> ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.1 ──

library(here)
#> here() starts at /Users/runner/work/inteRact/inteRact

Step 1: Load data, select events

#load US dict
data("us_2015_full")

#make a dataframe of events 
set.seed(729)
events <- tibble(actor = sample(us_2015_full$term[us_2015_full$type == "identity"], 50),
                 behavior = sample(us_2015_full$term[us_2015_full$type == "behavior"], 50),
                 object = sample(us_2015_full$term[us_2015_full$type == "identity"], 50))


head(events)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 3
#>   actor       behavior            object            
#>   <chr>       <chr>               <chr>             
#> 1 alumnus     pester              textile_worker    
#> 2 miner       challenge           blue_collar_worker
#> 3 hindu       astonish            puritan           
#> 4 chambermaid propose_marriage_to dropout           
#> 5 black_woman glance_at           priest            
#> 6 best_friend strip               bitch

Step 2: New equation data

-important – equations should follow the “Z” format from Interact (Heise)

your_equation_data <- read.table(here("data-raw/2010_equations.txt"))

your_equation_data
#>            V1    V2    V3    V4    V5    V6    V7    V8    V9   V10
#> 1  Z000000000 -0.16 -0.06 -0.05 -0.26  0.09  0.21 -0.18  0.00 -0.14

Step 3: Reshape it to be in the necessary format - use the reshape_equation function on the “Z” formatted table to generate a dataframe with the necessary colnames and variables for the other functions in the package.

reshaped_eq <- reshape_new_equation(your_equation_data)


glimpse(reshaped_eq)

#> Columns: 22

Step 4: run some calculations on the dataframe!

If you have a df already set with your events – you can format your code like this to calculate the deflection and get the optimal behavior for the


events %>% 
          rowwise() %>% 
          mutate(deflection = get_deflection(actor, behavior, object, 
                                             equation = "user supplied", 
                                             eq_df = reshaped_eq),
                 opt_beh = list(optimal_behavior(actor, behavior, object, 
                                                 equation = "user_supplied",
                                                 eq_df = reshaped_eq, which = "both"))) %>% 
          unnest(opt_beh) %>% head(10)
#> # A tibble: 10 x 8
#>    actor     behavior        object       deflection  opt_E   opt_P  opt_A term 
#>    <chr>     <chr>           <chr>             <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>
#>  1 alumnus   pester          textile_wor…      18.6   1.03   0.934   0.655 actor
#>  2 alumnus   pester          textile_wor…      18.6   0.145  0.663   0.471 obje…
#>  3 miner     challenge       blue_collar…       3.39  0.638  0.0539  0.282 actor
#>  4 miner     challenge       blue_collar…       3.39  0.457  0.890   0.243 obje…
#>  5 hindu     astonish        puritan            6.60  0.117  0.319  -1.17  actor
#>  6 hindu     astonish        puritan            6.60 -0.298  0.322  -1.18  obje…
#>  7 chamberm… propose_marria… dropout           17.9  -0.582 -0.757  -1.09  actor
#>  8 chamberm… propose_marria… dropout           17.9  -2.05  -0.678  -1.39  obje…
#>  9 black_wo… glance_at       priest             6.12  0.262  0.631   1.37  actor
#> 10 black_wo… glance_at       priest             6.12  1.75   1.54   -0.770 obje…

or if you only want predictions for actor/behavior –


act_events <- events %>% 
          rowwise() %>% 
          mutate(deflection = get_deflection(actor, behavior, object, 
                                             equation = "user supplied", 
                                             eq_df = reshaped_eq),
                 opt_beh = list(optimal_behavior(actor, behavior, object, 
                                                 equation = "user_supplied",
                                                 eq_df = reshaped_eq, which = "actor"))) %>% 
  unnest(opt_beh)

act_events %>% 
          head(10)
#> # A tibble: 10 x 8
#>    actor    behavior      object         deflection   opt_E   opt_P  opt_A term 
#>    <chr>    <chr>         <chr>               <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>
#>  1 alumnus  pester        textile_worker      18.6   1.03    0.934   0.655 actor
#>  2 miner    challenge     blue_collar_w…       3.39  0.638   0.0539  0.282 actor
#>  3 hindu    astonish      puritan              6.60  0.117   0.319  -1.17  actor
#>  4 chamber… propose_marr… dropout             17.9  -0.582  -0.757  -1.09  actor
#>  5 black_w… glance_at     priest               6.12  0.262   0.631   1.37  actor
#>  6 best_fr… strip         bitch               49.8   1.81    1.79    1.30  actor
#>  7 scrooge  curse         delinquent          17.1  -0.402  -1.06   -1.27  actor
#>  8 informer rib           newlywed             9.05  1.11   -0.735   0.763 actor
#>  9 informa… ignore        crane_operator      11.6   0.521  -0.353   0.777 actor
#> 10 houseke… surprise      advertising_c…       8.59  0.0917 -0.205  -0.931 actor

You can also search for the closest behavior to the opt_behavior:

act_events <- act_events %>% 
              rowwise() %>% 
              mutate(closest_beh = closest_term(e = opt_E,
                                                p = opt_P,
                                                a = opt_A,
                                                term_typ = "behavior",
                                                max_dist = 1,
                                                num_terms = 1))

act_events %>% head()
#> # A tibble: 6 x 9
#> # Rowwise: 
#>   actor  behavior object deflection  opt_E   opt_P  opt_A term  closest_beh$ter…
#>   <chr>  <chr>    <chr>       <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr> <chr>           
#> 1 alumn… pester   texti…      18.6   1.03   0.934   0.655 actor bargain_with    
#> 2 miner  challen… blue_…       3.39  0.638  0.0539  0.282 actor curry_favor_from
#> 3 hindu  astonish purit…       6.60  0.117  0.319  -1.17  actor endure          
#> 4 chamb… propose… dropo…      17.9  -0.582 -0.757  -1.09  actor concede_to      
#> 5 black… glance_… priest       6.12  0.262  0.631   1.37  actor kid             
#> 6 best_… strip    bitch       49.8   1.81   1.79    1.30  actor engage
